div.head: Edward Deane Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen IEdward Deane being now very weak and weake
but yet sound and perfect memory do in the presents of these ministers make this
my latest and last will and testament first bequeathing my soul to god
my maker and also my body to the Earth from where it came with decent
burial secondly to all and wery of my conditions his just deces and for all other
worldly goods as lands chattel hogs in of what sort werthat doth
properly belong into me I do hear in the presence of these ministers bequeath
them all and every of them unto Elizabeth Lindsey daughter of Mr. Hames Linsey
of Charles County in Maryland appointing and ordaining her the said Elizabeth
after my decease my sole heir to enjoy and prosper all and every of such lands
chattle and good as in my lifetime did properly belong unto me for her and her
hares forever only I desiring the father of said Elizabeth and mother may
enjoy of al the said lands, chattels, and goods untill the said Elizabeth
shall be married or come of age as namely the plantation that Sarah
Cofer dwels upon with all rights and benefits that doth or might
belong unto me and also one heifer and one younger sterne that is at John
Wheelers and one small that with name and my which is at
Bennet Maguires as also and frying pan that is there therase and all other
Things that doath belong unto me Edward Deane I doe this sixth day of April
in the year of our Lord Anno Domini One Thousand six hundred and twenty
bequeath unto the said Elizabeth Lindsey after she shall come of age and her first
marriage to enjoy and prosper for she and her heirs forever James &
Mary Lindsey the father and mother of the said Elizabeth to enjoy and profits
all the contents of the above specified untill the said Elizabeth shall come of age
or be marryed and then to surrender the same unto the said Elizabeth and if
the said Elizabeth shall die before she shall come of age or be marryed then the
nearest of her kindred to enjoy the same sae committing my soule unto God I do
here in the presents of these ministers confine My last will and testament
and set to my hand and seal this day and year above written
In the presents of us
Ralph Coates
John Gosling
Richard R Wall
Mark
his mark
Edward X Deane

On the back of the forgoing was the forgoing was thus endorsed to weit
To the honorable Mr. William Fattoll Baronett Chief Judge of Testamentary causes
within the provinace of Maryland by virtue of a commision from his hon. bearing
date y. eight day of september in the 40th year of the Dominion of julius
anno domini 1671 to me directed and me to call before me the several
witnesses to the last will and testament of Edward Deane late of Charles County deceased and by this oaths to eause the same to be approved these are humbly to certifee that on the
fourteenth day of september in the year above came before me Ralph Bates
and Richard Wall two of the witnesses to the within written will and made oath
that they saw the written named Edward Deane sign seal and publish the within
writing as his last will and testament that he was in perfect &
memory when he Executed the same.
5 2/4 sides Benj.a Roger
